intro: Dipteracanthus australasicus subsp. dalyensis, commonly known as the Daly's dipteracanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The subspecies is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
